name: illusorily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not real or not really what it seems: The bold sweep of the fabric over his arm appears, illusorily, as if it had been painted in a few seconds. They supported colonialism in order to defend, albeit illusorily, their social situation of wealth and power.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople may illusorily perceive the written forms of two different words as if they were the same.The structural challenge is to create a light, thin construction illusorily made of concrete.
